intro: Micropholis rufa, commonly known as the red-leaf micropholis, is a small evergreen tree native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn reddish in color during the dry season. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits. Micropholis rufa is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate salt spray, making it a hardy species in coastal environments.
